page.title: 06HEDGEROWS AROUND OGBOURNE
page.content: {Hedges 14775m { Fences 12900m { New 300m { Gone 3850m This table gives the overall length of all the hedges, fences, new boundaries and boundaries that have been ripped out in the Ogbourne/Rockley area. We dated our hedges by counting the number of species in a piece of hedge 30 yards long. One species (excluding climbers) equals about 100 years. Our oldest hedge was about 900 years old, and the average age for a hedge is about 500 years.This table shows the 5 most common species of shrubs in our hedges. { 1 Hawthorn { 2 Hazel { 3 Elder { 4 Blackthorn(Sloe) { 5 Rose
